item.title: GISEC GLOBAL 2026 – The Middle East &amp; Africa’s Largest Cybersecurity Event
5 Threats That Reshaped Web Security This Year [2025]
item.description: As 2025 draws to a close, security professionals face a sobering realization: the traditional playbook for web security has become dangerously obsolete. AI-powered attacks, evolving injection techniques, and supply chain compromises affecting hundreds of thousands of websites forced a fundamental rethink of defensive strategies. Here are the five threats that reshaped web security this year, and
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Skills Shortages Trump Headcount as Critical Cyber Challenge
item.description: ISC2 report reveals 59% of global organizations have critical or significant skills shortages

item.title: Microsoft Silently Fixes 8-Year Windows Security Flaw
item.description: <p>The flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-9491, allowed cybercriminals to hide malicious commands from users inspecting files through Windows' standard interface.</p> <p>The post <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com/article/news-microsoft-fixes-security-flaw/">Microsoft Silently Fixes 8-Year Windows Security Flaw</a> appeared first on <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com">TechRepublic</a>.</p>
item.dc:creator: TechRepublic Staff

item.title: Post Office Escapes £1m Fine After Postmaster Data Breach
item.description: The Information Commissioner’s Office has chosen only to reprimand the Post Office after a 2024 breach

item.title: GoldFactory Hits Southeast Asia with Modified Banking Apps Driving 11,000+ Infections
item.description: Cybercriminals associated with a financially motivated group known as GoldFactory have been observed staging a fresh round of attacks targeting mobile users in Indonesia, Thailand, and Vietnam by impersonating government services. The activity, observed since October 2024, involves distributing modified banking applications that act as a conduit for Android malware, Group-IB said in a technical
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: 'MuddyWater' Hackers Target Israeli Orgs With Retro Game Tactic
item.description: Iran's top state-sponsored APT is usually rather crass. But in a recent spate of attacks, it tried out some interesting evasion tactics, including delving into Snake, an old-school mobile game.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: Record 29.7 Tbps DDoS Attack Linked to AISURU Botnet with up to 4 Million Infected Hosts
item.description: Cloudflare on Wednesday said it detected and mitigated the largest ever distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack that measured at 29.7 terabits per second (Tbps). The activity, the web infrastructure and security company said, originated from a DDoS botnet-for-hire known as AISURU, which has been linked to a number of hyper-volumetric DDoS attacks over the past year. The attack lasted for 69
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: 'ShadyPanda' Hackers Weaponize Millions of Browsers
item.description: The China-based cyber-threat group has been quietly using malicious extensions on the Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge marketplaces to spy on millions of users.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Critical React Flaw Triggers Calls for Immediate Action
item.description: The vulnerability, which was assigned two CVEs with maximum CVSS scores of 10, may affect more than a third of cloud service providers.
item.dc:creator: Rob Wright

item.title: Arizona AG Sues Temu Over 'Stealing' User Data
item.description: The suit alleges the Chinese retailer's app secretly accesses and harvests users' sensitive information without their knowledge or consent.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Culafi

item.title: Critical RSC Bugs in React and Next.js Allow Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
item.description: A maximum-severity security flaw has been disclosed in React Server Components (RSC) that, if successfully exploited, could result in remote code execution. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-55182, carries a CVSS score of 10.0. The vulnerability has been codenamed React2shell. It allows "unauthenticated remote code execution by exploiting a flaw in how React decodes payloads sent to React
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Discover the AI Tools Fueling the Next Cybercrime Wave — Watch the Webinar
item.description: Remember when phishing emails were easy to spot? Bad grammar, weird formatting, and requests from a "Prince" in a distant country? Those days are over. Today, a 16-year-old with zero coding skills and a $200 allowance can launch a campaign that rivals state-sponsored hackers. They don't need to be smart; they just need to subscribe to the right AI tool. We are witnessing the industrialization of
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Microsoft Silently Patches Windows LNK Flaw After Years of Active Exploitation
item.description: Microsoft has silently plugged a security flaw that has been exploited by several threat actors since 2017 as part of the company's November 2025 Patch Tuesday updates, according to ACROS Security's 0patch. The vulnerability in question is CVE-2025-9491 (CVSS score: 7.8/7.0), which has been described as a Windows Shortcut (LNK) file UI misinterpretation vulnerability that could lead to remote
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: WordPress King Addons Flaw Under Active Attack Lets Hackers Make Admin Accounts
item.description: A critical security flaw impacting a WordPress plugin known as King Addons for Elementor has come under active exploitation in the wild. The vulnerability, CVE-2025-8489 (CVSS score: 9.8), is a case of privilege escalation that allows unauthenticated attackers to grant themselves administrative privileges by simply specifying the administrator user role during registration. It affects versions
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: French NGO Reporters Without Borders Targeted by Star Blizzard
item.description: A fresh wave of spear-phishing linked to the Russia-based Star Blizzard group has been detected by Sekoia

item.title: UK's Cyber Service for Telcos Blocks 1 Billion Malicious Site Attempts
item.description: A new cyber defense service has prevented almost one billion early-stage cyber-attacks in the past year, British Security Minister claims

item.title: FBI Flags Rising Holiday Scams Spreading Across Email, Social, and Web
item.description: <p>The FBI warns holiday scammers are hitting email, social media, fake sites, delivery alerts, and calls, with new data showing losses and complaints rising.</p> <p>The post <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com/article/news-fbi-holiday-scams-multichannel-warning/">FBI Flags Rising Holiday Scams Spreading Across Email, Social, and Web</a> appeared first on <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com">TechRepublic</a>.</p>
item.dc:creator: Liz Ticong

item.title: Brazil Hit by Banking Trojan Spread via WhatsApp Worm and RelayNFC NFC Relay Fraud
item.description: The threat actor known as Water Saci is actively evolving its tactics, switching to a sophisticated, highly layered infection chain that uses HTML Application (HTA) files and PDFs to propagate via WhatsApp a worm that deploys a banking trojan in attacks targeting users in Brazil. The latest wave is characterized by the attackers shifting from PowerShell to a Python-based variant that spreads the
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Yearn Finance yETH Pool Hit by $9M Exploit
item.description: A critical vulnerability in Yearn Finance's yETH pool allowed an attacker to steal around $9m

item.title: The Ransomware Holiday Bind: Burnout or Be Vulnerable
item.description: Ransomware groups target enterprises during off-hours, weekends, and holidays when security teams are stretched thin and response times lag.
item.dc:creator: Arielle Waldman

item.title: UK Ransomware Payment Ban to Come with Exemptions, Security Minster Say
item.description: The UK government’s proposed ransomware payment ban for public sector and critical infrastructure will come with national security exemptions

item.title: Disinformation and Cyber-Threats Among Top Global Exec Concerns
item.description: A new WEF report reveals that AI-powered threats like disinformation are among executives’ biggest concerns

item.title: AI Bolsters Python Variant of Brazilian WhatsApp Attacks
item.description: Water Saci has upgraded its self-propagating malware to compromise banks and cryptocurrency exchanges by targeting enterprise users of the popular chat app.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributing Writer

item.title: Pall Mall Process to Define Responsible Commercial Cyber Intrusion
item.description: The Pall Mall Process begins outreach to define guidelines for private commercial intrusion industry

item.title: Chopping AI Down to Size: Turning Disruptive Technology into a Strategic Advantage
item.description: Most people know the story of Paul Bunyan. A giant lumberjack, a trusted axe, and a challenge from a machine that promised to outpace him. Paul doubled down on his old way of working, swung harder, and still lost by a quarter inch. His mistake was not losing the contest. His mistake was assuming that effort alone could outmatch a new kind of tool. Security professionals are facing a similar
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Google Fixes 107 Android Flaws
item.description: <p>The December security bulletin revealed that attackers had been conducting "limited, targeted exploitation" of framework vulnerabilities.</p> <p>The post <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com/article/news-google-fixes-android-flaws/">Google Fixes 107 Android Flaws</a> appeared first on <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com">TechRepublic</a>.</p>
item.dc:creator: TechRepublic Staff

item.title: Picklescan Bugs Allow Malicious PyTorch Models to Evade Scans and Execute Code
item.description: Three critical security flaws have been disclosed in an open-source utility called Picklescan that could allow malicious actors to execute arbitrary code by loading untrusted PyTorch models, effectively bypassing the tool's protections. Picklescan, developed and maintained by Matthieu Maitre (@mmaitre314), is a security scanner that's designed to parse Python pickle files and detect suspicious
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Malicious Rust Crate Delivers OS-Specific Malware to Web3 Developer Systems
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a malicious Rust package that's capable of targeting Windows, macOS, and Linux systems, and features malicious functionality to stealthily execute on developer machines by masquerading as an Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) unit helper tool. The Rust crate, named "evm-units," was uploaded to crates.io in mid-April 2025 by a user named "ablerust,"
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
